      • getDeductionsEnterprise

        public java.util.Map<EconomicalField,java.lang.Double> getDeductionsEnterprise(java.lang.Integer nif)
        Maps the deductions the invoices of an enterprise represent to their customers, according to the EconomicalField
        Parameters:
        nif - of enterprise
        Returns:
        Map, with keys as the EconomicalFields an Enterprise can issue invoices to, and the value the deduction they represent (sum of deductions of individuals).

      • getEnterprisesThatIssueTheMost

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Double,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> getEnterprisesThatIssueTheMost(int N)
        Maps the enterprises that issue the most with the deductions they represent It's listed by most deductions first, given the list ordered by most issued value.
        Parameters:
        N - limiter of enterprises
        Returns:
        Map, keys as deductions to all NIFs who have the same deduction value

        Returns:

        end - end date

      • mapEnterpriseToDeduction

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Double,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> mapEnterpriseToDeduction(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> enterprises)
        Given a list of NIFs of enterprises, orders the Nifs according to the deduction value the invoices of the enterprise represents to the end users
        Parameters:
        enterprises - list ordered by most issued value
        Returns:
        Map, with keys as deductions and values the NIFs that have that deduction value

      • userLogin

        public int userLogin(int nif,
                     java.lang.String password)
              throws UserDoesNotExistInDatabaseException
        Method that returns boolean if user credentials match the ones in the database
        Parameters:
        nif - nif of user
        password - alleged password
        Returns:
        1 if Admin, 2 if Individual, 3 if Enterprise, 4 if failed
        Throws:
        UserDoesNotExistInDatabaseException
